abstract.para: This specification describes the p:text-head, p:text-join, and p:text-tail steps for XProc 3.0: An XML Pipeline Language.

para.emphasis: This section describes the status of this document at the time of its publication. Other documents may supersede this document.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: This specification describes the p:text-head, p:text-join, and p:text-tail XProc steps. A machine-readable description of these steps may be found in steps.xpl.
Familarity with the general nature of steps is assumed; for background details, see .

section.title: p:text-head
section.para: The p:text-head step returns lines from the beginning of a text file.
The p:text-head step returns lines of the file named in the href option:

listitem.para: If the count option is positive, the p:text-head step returns the first count lines
If the count option is zero, the p:text-head step returns all lines
If the count option is negative, the p:text-head step returns all lines except the first count lines

section.para: It is a dynamic error if the href option value is not a valid xs:anyURI. If the href option is relative, it is made absolute against the base URI of the element on which it is specified (p:with-option or p:text-head in the case of a syntactic shortcut value).
The step returns a c:result element containing one c:line child element for each line. Lines are identified as described in XML, 2.11 End-of-Line Handling

section.title: p:text-join
section.para: The p:text-join step concatenates two or more text files.

section.title: p:text-tail
section.para: The p:text-tail step returns lines from the end of a text file.
The p:text-tail step returns lines of the file named in the href option:

listitem.para: If the count option is positive, the p:text-tail step returns the last count lines
If the count option is zero, the p:text-tail step returns all lines
If the count option is negative, the p:text-tail step returns all lines except the last count lines

section.para: It is a dynamic error if the href option value is not a valid xs:anyURI. If the href option is relative, it is made absolute against the base URI of the element on which it is specified (p:with-option or p:text-tail in the case of a syntactic shortcut value).
The step returns a c:result element containing one c:line child element for each line. Lines are identified as described in XML, 2.11 End-of-Line Handling

section.title: Step Errors
section.para: This step can raise dynamic errors.

A dynamic error is one which occurs while a pipeline is being evaluated. Examples of dynamic errors include references to URIs that cannot be resolved, steps which fail, and pipelines that exhaust the capacity of an implementation (such as memory or disk space). For a more complete discussion of dynamic errors, see .

If a step fails due to a dynamic error, failure propagates upwards until either a p:try is encountered or the entire pipeline fails. In other words, outside of a p:try, step failure causes the entire pipeline to fail.
